required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Immunogenicity and Safety Evaluation of QIS in Healthy Subjects
clinical_study.official_title: Immunogenicity and Safety Evaluation of AdimFlu-S Quadrivalent Inactivated Influenza Vaccine (QIS) in Healthy Subjects Aged 3 Years Old to 17 Years Old

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study was to evaluate the antibody response to each of the four influenza vaccine strains included in the study vaccine, as measured by hemagglutination inhibition (HAI) at 4 weeks after the last dose of the study vaccine in young subjects aged between 3 years old and 17 years old.

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluate the immunogenicity profiles for influenza virus vaccine strains of the AdimFlu-S (QIS) by seroconversion rate
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline for anti-hemaglutinin antibodies at 28 days post immunization
primary_outcome.description: The primary endpoint of immunogenicity evaluation was the seroconversion rate

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluate the immunogenicity profiles for influenza virus vaccine strains of the AdimFlu-S (QIS) by geometric mean folds increase
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline for anti-hemaglutinin antibodies at 28 days post immunization
primary_outcome.description: The primary endpoint of immunogenicity evaluation was the geometric mean folds increase

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluate the immunogenicity profiles for influenza virus vaccine strains of the AdimFlu-S (QIS) by seroprotection rate
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline for anti-hemaglutinin antibodies at 28 days post immunization
secondary_outcome.description: The secondary endpoint of immunogenicity evaluation was the seroprotection rate

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluate the safety and tolerability profiles including the presence or absence of the pre-specified reactogenicity events and other serious/non-serious adverse events of the AdimFlu-S (QIS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: In regard to the long term safety of the study vaccine, the significant and/or serious adverse event(s) will be recorded during the 6 months follow up after the scheduled last vaccination
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluate the safety and tolerability profiles including the presence or absence of the pre-specified reactogenicity events and other serious/non-serious adverse events of QIS. Reactogenicity events were pre-specified adverse events systematically recorded on diary cards during post-vaccination period by all participants for 7 days after each vaccination. Unsolicited adverse events were recorded on the diary card till 28 days post vaccination, while serious adverse events should be recorded throughout the study period

arm_group.description: Aged 3 to 8 years old vaccine naïve subject (without prior seasonal influenza vaccine exposure)
Aged 3 to 8 years old vaccine non-naïve subject (with prior seasonal influenza vaccine exposure)

intervention.description: This was an open study to demonstrate the use of AdimFlu-S (QIS) (2016-2017 season) vaccine in young subjects aged between 3 years old to 17 years old. All subjects were divided into two subgroups. That were subjects aged 3 to 8 years old, who received 2 doses of 0.5 mL vaccine separated by 4 weeks, and subjects aged 9 to 17 years old, who received one dose of 0.5 mL vaccine.
